findings.title: Related-nonce attacks across keys allow root key recovery
findings.description: Given multiple addresses generated by the same sender, if any two signatures with the associated private keys use the same nonce, then the recipient’s private root key can be recovered.

findings.title: 2. Limited forgeries for related keys
findings.description: If Bob signs a message for an address generated by Alice, Alice can convert it into a valid signature for another address.

findings.title: Mutual transactions can be completely deanonymized
findings.description: Pairwise transactions (from Alice to Bob and from Bob to Alice) can be deanonymized because the shared secret is equal, resulting in derived root public keys for pairwise transactions with the same index having a constant difference that can be detected by an attacker.

findings.title: Allowing invalid public keys may enable DH private key recovery
findings.description: An attacker can use invalid public keys to cause the recipient to leak information on their DH private key according to well-known invalid point attacks.
